item.title: Small error
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Urh, hate to burst your bubble, but your wrong. Im not missing anything.

command.substring(8);

Is allowed in commands because. This is what the method looks like

	public void customCommand(String command) {

String command.

So i tried to make a method. With that, and it said like. Cannot be applied to … Etc…

So basically i give up for a few hours…

And when you said read it, do what it tells you. It’s telling me to do nothing. It’s telling me there is an error somewhere. It cannot recognize command.substring(8);

Kty[br][size=1]Posted on: October 22, 2007, 08:32:13 PM[/size][hr][quote=“tj007razor, post:3, topic:153709”]First of all [quote]client.java:22412: p is already defined in parseIncomingPackets()
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(Playahaz);
^
client.java:22413: c is already defined in parseIncomingPackets()
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];[/quote] that means you’ve already initialized those somewhere else in the parseIncomingPackets() void. You’ve defined them twice just right there. The other two, not sure I’ll try and see if I can’t find anything about it.[/quote]

YaH cuz i have 2 cases…

Read full topic

item.title: Small error
item.dc:creator: @tj007razor tj007razor
item.description:
@tj007razor wrote:

First of all

client.java:22412: p is already defined in parseIncomingPackets()
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(Playahaz);
^
client.java:22413: c is already defined in parseIncomingPackets()
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
that means you’ve already initialized those somewhere else in the parseIncomingPackets() void. You’ve defined them twice just right there. The other two, not sure I’ll try and see if I can’t find anything about it.

Read full topic

~dan[br][size=1]Posted on: October 22, 2007, 08:26:18 PM[/size][hr]Oh, by the way, It’s common that if you fix one error the others will vanish, so find that one error and you’ll be allset.

item.title: Small error
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Haider… I’ve been getting 4 errors, when i add these cases.

case 16199:
String Playah = command.substring(8);
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(Playah);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
if (Example2 >= 100) {
c.playerRights = 1;
Example2 -= 100;
sendMessage("Bleh");
}else{
sendMessage("Bleh");
}
break;
case 16200:
String Playahaz = command.substring(8);
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(Playahaz);
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
if (Example >= 130) {
c.playerRights = 2;
Example -= 130;
sendMessage("Blah");
}else{
sendMessage("Blah");
}
break;

The errors are…

client.java:22399: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable command
location: class client
String Playah = command.substring(8);
                ^
client.java:22411: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable command
location: class client
String Playahaz = command.substring(8);
                  ^
client.java:22412: p is already defined in parseIncomingPackets()
int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(Playahaz);
    ^
client.java:22413: c is already defined in parseIncomingPackets()
client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];
       ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
4 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!

Anyone any ideas :|?

Read full topic
